args: Please note that this story contains spoilers\nfor the ＂A Wish to the Winds＂ event.
I can't apologize enough for agreeing\nto offer up Lowen as a sacrifice.
But I was unable to find any other option...
I get that—but that doesn't mean I'm\nwilling to shrug it off as if nothing\nhappened!
You put my brother in grave danger!
Yeah, but everything was okay in the end,\nso let's just call it water under the bridge.
I promise that we will make up for what\nyou had to endure, young Lowen.
So what is your plan going forward?
Thanks to you, the prince has agreed to\nhelp protect us from fiends in the future.
Which means we can stop being\nreliant on Garuda.
You DO understand why Garuda asked\nfor a sacrifice in the first place, right?
It's because of how lonely she was\nduring the time she was protecting\nthe people of this village.

She sacrificed everything for our people,
so I hope you are not intending to simply
turn your back on her now that another
option has presented itself!
Put your fears at ease. No matter who\nprotects us, we shall continue to revere\nGaruda as we always have.
We will all work together to ensure\nshe never feels lonely again.
Hmm? The wind seems different somehow.
I hope nothing happened to Garuda.\nWe should go check on her!
But that cliff is really dangerous...
Well, I'm going, so if you wanna come,\nyou better hurry it up!
All right, all right! Wait for me!
So this is where Garuda lives...
The air here is so dry and depressing.\nIt's no wonder she felt lonely living in\na place like this all by herself.
No need to sound so disappointed.
What do you want from me, Lowen?
The wind in the village feels...different.
It was sort of gloomy, so I worried\nsomething happened to you.
No matter how I try to hide it,\nthe wind reveals the truth.
Then what is it? What's wrong?
As this village now lives under the prince's\nprotection, mine is no longer required.
But everyone realizes they were wrong!\nThey won't let you be lonely again!
Are you sure you still want to go?
I am not leaving because of loneliness;\nit is because I no longer need to worry.
Fear for the village's safety kept me here\nin the past. But now...
Well, perhaps your prince saw this coming.
So does that mean we'll never\nsee each other again?!
We just became friends!\nI don't want you to go!
If ever you need my assistance,\nI promise to fly to your aid.
Hee hee! I'm gonna hold you to that.
Perhaps we could all be friends.
I have Lowen. You are unnecessary.
I attempt to hold out an olive branch\nand THAT is your response?!
Besides, I'll have you know\nthat Lowen belongs to me!
I thought you were planning\nto give him more space?
Not if it means you're going to\nrush in to fill that gap!
Aaaah ha ha! Oh, what fun this is.
...Heh. I suppose it IS a bit silly.
It IS pretty great—and it's all because\nGaruda asked for you to be a sacrifice.
Well, and because the prince decided\nto step in and help us out.
Were it not for those events, it is\nunlikely either you or I would be\nleaving this village.
Honestly, I STILL have a number\nof reservations about leaving.
This village contains memories of our\nparents. If I wanted to keep living here\nas if nothing happened, I'm sure I could.
Yet because of what you learned about\nyourself, you will not do so?
That's right. Leaving the village let both\nLowen and I realize how much stronger\nwe need to become.
Running from the truth won't help\neither of us do that.
We're going to the Halidom to fight\nwith the prince and his friends.
Yeah! I'm gonna get strong and protect\nwhat I care about just like he does!
I am certain you will be able to make\nthat dream come true in time.
I intend to fly about the world\nand grow stronger myself.
It was a terrible mistake to let my\nloneliness overtake me, and I do not\nintend to make that same error twice.
Well, I have said my parting words.\nThis is farewell.
But this isn't the last time we're\ngonna see each other, right?!
No. We shall meet again, you and I.
Take care, Garuda! We'll be waiting!
Hmm? The wind just changed\ndirection all of a sudden.
It feels like it's pushing us forward.
Ha ha! She could have just TOLD us that's\nhow she felt instead of being so sly!
Yeah, but I think the wind actually shows\nher feelings better than she does.
I suppose the wind is telling us\nto go forth and do our best.

O wind! Messenger of the promised land
Your breath bring naught but joy
Wherever you blow and however grand
We'll always your breezes enjoy
We're leaving this place\njust as you did, Garuda.
Because there's a whole world\nout there waiting for us!
